justification: “In the first experiment, the relationship between prior experience and behavior adaptation was quantified in a simple binary decision task” – the object-sorting mini-game in Airport Scanner was used to capture these adaptations.

“Experiment 2 looked to replicate the data-driven analysis of Experiment 1 in a visual search task… the primary task in the Airport Scanner game was a visual search task where players look for prohibited items among allowed items.”

measured_by: Headphones-distractor trials in Airport Scanner Visual Search Task
justification: In Experiment 3, “the purpose of this analysis was to determine if the same evidence accumulation function… described the relationship between players’ experience with ignoring… a salient distractor (the ‘headphones’) and subsequent performance.”

measured_by: Bag-type manipulation in Airport Scanner Visual Search Task
justification: Experiment 3 evaluated “players’ exposure to each of the four major bag types… despite bag type lacking any predictive value of response,” linking prior bag-type exposure to later performance.
